text:
echoproperties - it would be useful if the output could be optionally sorted. 
E.g. add optional "sort" attribute, default false (to keep existing behaviour).

[Yes, one can put the output to a file and sort that, but it would be easier 
if the facility was built-in].
creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
jan@materne.de
text:
An idea: a ContainerTask which accepts FilterChains. So a construct like

<catchoutput>
    <echoproperties/>
    <filterchain>
        <sort/>
    </filterchain>
</catchoutput>

would be possible. 
Advantages:
- reuse for all tasks (which writes to STDOUT)
- reuse of the filterchain

creator: frizbog@charter.net

Created attachment 12550

creator: mbenson@apache.org
frizbog@charter.net
text:
There is no real point in making the sort optional.  Right now, since the 
properties are kept in a Hashtable, the order is indeterminate, so there is no 
legitimate claim that changing in the order should be a problem for anyone.  
Anyone relying on the output of echoproperties being in random order "gets 
what they deserve."  ;-)

Matt Benson's point is correct - the XML format is already sorted.  The patch 
I added makes the flat file format (which goes to the logger if no destfile is 
specified) sorted as well.

reopening this bug so we dont lose it. Matthew -we keep bugreps open till the
patch is applied; fixed means the code is fixed, not that we have a patch in it.

I take your point about sorting, it was me that added the feature for the XML
one. I think it was laziness that stopped me doing the same for the normal list.
We were handing the output to the os, and didnt want to redo it. 

One issue: you say that part of the patch is copied from java.util.properties.
Was that a literal copy. if so, we cannot put it in the source tree as is.
creator: stevel@apache.org

text:
Yes, it was a literal copy, but its source was attributed.  If that is not 
sufficient, better trash the patch in its current form and do something else.
creator: frizbog@charter.net

text:
Looking at this code again, I agree that sorted output is good, but we can't
include stuff from the Java Source tree unless the copyright holders (Sun) give
it to us. 

So we'd need a reimplementation of this. Given the sublties of property files, I
am too scared to do it, even if I had time. Leaving for anyone else.

internally, write the header, and write the properties in sorted order?  I have
not looked at the patch so that I will not be compromised or influenced in any way.
